The National Technical Information Servi: NTIS) is an obscure office within the U.S. Commerce Department that serves as the main repository for government-funded technical, scientific, and business reports.
The NTIS estimates that it holds over 3: but its own website encourages users to check with other government agencies and conduct internet searches before requesting documents.
The Government Accountability Office: GAO) conducted a study in 2012 and found that 74 percent of the NTIS reports between 1990 and 2011 were readily available elsewhere, usually from the originating agency's website.
The NTIS Director: Bruce Borzino, argued that his office is responsible for posting many reports to the web, and many other federal departments lack the technical expertise to maintain permanent access to their information.
